intro: Acinodendron stenourum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
